questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

From Microsoft Purview, you plan to create a content search for email messages that have a recipient of either user1@contoso.com or user2.contoso.com.

You need to add a condition to the KQL editor for the content search.

Which KQL query should you add as a condition?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Equals operator is "=" and OR operator is also correct for specifying 2 or more conditions

Selected Answer: D
you should use the OR operator.

Selected Answer: D
D, is correct equals operator is "=" and or operator is also correct.

Selected Answer: D
D, others are wrong

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 tenant that has data loss prevention (DLP) policies.

You need to create a report that includes the following:

• Documents that have a matched DLP policy.
• Documents that have had a sensitivity label changed.
• Documents that have had a sensitivity label changed.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Activity explorer page has below heading in compliance portal :
"Review activity related to content that contains sensitive info or has labels applied, such as what labels were changed, files were modified, and more. " . It matches with the question.

Selected Answer: D
Activity explorer will allow us to create a report. 
We don't need to view content, or review communications. 
Were also not trying to put data on hold doing initial due diligance

comments.content: A is wrong, please do a bit of research. Content search is about content and not about activities like label applied, removed /changed etc. For that there is activity exploere.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Content search is required

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

Use the following login credentials as needed:

To enter your username, place your cursor in the Sign in box and click on the username below.

To enter your password, place your cursor in the Enter password box and click on the password below.

Microsoft 365 Username: admin@123456789.onmicrosoft.com
Microsoft 365 Password: **********

If the Microsoft 365 portal does not load successfully in the browser, press CTRL-K to reload the portal in a new browser tab.

The following information is for technical support purposes only:

Lab Instance: 12345678
-

You are investigating a data breach.

You need to retain all Microsoft Exchange items in the mailbox of Alex Wilber that contain the word Falcon and were created in the year 2021.

To complete this task, sign in to the appropriate admin center.

discussion.content: for email, it's not "created" but "sent". "Created" will fire a warning

When I add the filters in my lab I always get the warning:
You have used filters that will not apply to a specific workload you selected earlier.
Condition Filters Dropped
Created Exchange

comments.content: The condition should not be created but received.

"received" only would be incomplete. what about emails sent by Alex that are in sent items folder that have the keyword "Falcon"? should they not be included? I think it should look like this:
falcon (c:c) ((Sent>2020-12-31) OR (Received>2020-12-31))

discussion.content:
Correct - User 1 - Analyst 
User 2 - Investigator 
User 3 - Admin

Difference between investigator and analyst - an analyst will be focussing on analysing policies and gaining insights but an investigator will need to look into the the file content for thorough analysis

Given answers are correct:
User1 Analyst: this role allows the user to investigate policy matches but does not grant permissions to view the file content related to the match.
User2 Investigator: this role allows the user to investigate policy matches and also view the file content related to the match.
User3 Administrator: because the Privacy Management Contributor is not enough.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/privacy/priva/priva-permissions

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and use Microsoft Purview.

The subscription contains the following users:

• User1: Must be able to investigate policy matches, but unable to view the file content related to the match.
• User2: Must be able to investigate policy matches and view the file content related to the match.
• User3: Must be able to create, update, and delete Microsoft Priva Privacy Risk Management policies.

You need to add each user to a role group. The solution must follow the principle of least privilege.

To which role group should you add each user? To answer, drag the appropriate role groups to the correct users. Each group may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The key here is that an E3 is in the environment, and Regulatory templates do not come with E3. 
Licensing always comes first!

Selected Answer: A
You need to uplift to an E5 licence. Regulatory templates do not come with E3 but you have 3 templates included with E5, if you need more you need to purchase them on top of the E5 licence.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/compliance-manager-regulations-list#premium-regulations
You cannot add a a recommended assessments via E3 in the compliance center so you would need an E5!

Selected Answer: C
C. Add recommended assessments.

Adding recommended assessments might be helpful, but the primary step is to activate the template itself. This will provide the core set of controls and assessments specific to achieving ISO/IEC 27001 compliance within the context of Microsoft 365.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E3 subscription.

You plan to assess compliance with ISO/IEC 27001:2013.

From Compliance Manager, you discover that the ISO/IEC 27001:2013 regulatory template for Microsoft 365 is inactive.

What should you do?
